bibl.title: Despatch from Owen L. W. Smith to David J. Hill, October 15, 1900
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

p.add: INDEX BUREAU REC'D 23 NOV 1900 DEPT OF STATE

div1.p: No. 49. Consular. Legation of the United States. Monrovia Liberia, Oct. 15, 1900.
Hon. David J Hill, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington.
Subject. The organization of a prospective Coast Mining Association in Liberia.
No. 49. Consular. Legation of the United States, Monrovia Liberia, Oct. 15 1900.
Hon. David J. Hill, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington.

Sir: I have the honor to transmit, herewith, the intelligence, that a prospecting company, with His Excellency President Coleman, at the head, has been recently organized, for the porpose of Coal Mining, in the neighborhood of Grand Cape Mount, Liberia.
I have the honor to be your obedient servant; Owen L. W. Smith M. R. and C. General.
